title: Birlasoft’s net profit grew 11.8% to Rs 180 crore
description: Birlasoft's Q4 saw a net profit of Rs 180 crore, 11.8% QoQ growth. Revenue stood at Rs 1,363 crore, up 1.5%. Operating margin ended at 14.7%. The firm recommended a dividend of Rs 4/share.
content: C K Birla group’s IT firm, Birlasoft reported a net profit of Rs 180 crore in the March quarter of FY24, up 11.8% quarter on quarter (QoQ). The profit for the company grew by a whopping 60.5% on-year.The growth in profit in Q4 comes on the back of surge in non-core income, slight increase in operating margin and a decline in employee expenses. Operating margin jacked up by 33 bps (3.8% QoQ) to end at 14.7% in the final quarter of FY24.The revenue for the Pune-based company in Q4 stood at Rs 1,363 crore, up 1.5% sequentially. In December quarter the IT service provider posted a revenue of Rs 1,343 crore. For the full fiscal 24, the company's revenue came at Rs 5,278 crore, up by 10.1% on-year. The IT company’s board has recommended a final dividend of Rs 4 per share. Angan Guha, CEO and MD, Birlasoft, said, “On a constant currency basis, our revenues have grown 9.1% ex Invacare during FY 24 and revenues during the fourth quarter are up 1.6% sequentially." Invacare was the US based client of Birlasoft that filed for bankruptcy last year.
